title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
lucaa - (00:03): done! we should now have nice annotations in enterprise default build  
sdumitriu - (00:04): Hum, any idea how to get hold of a StringBuffer in Velocity?  
gmpff left at 00:06 (Ping timeout: 246 seconds  
lucaa - (00:07): sdumitriu: you could try to get it as a return value from smth else: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/class-use/StringBuffer.html  
lucaa - (00:08): but there aren't that many options :( and none usable afaics  
vmassol - (00:08): the thing is, you're not supposed to need one I guess  
vmassol - (00:09): ie maybe you need a higher level api in java to do what you want to do?  
lucaa - (00:09): vmassol: well, it's obvious sdumitriu is trying to do too much in velocity :)  
lucaa - (00:09): but let's help him, I trust he's doing it for a good purpose :)  
sdumitriu - (00:10): I can do it with a plain String and a lot of appends  
sdumitriu - (00:11): It's going to be a bit slower  
sdumitriu - (00:23): Cool, I have section editing  
sdumitriu - (00:24): And permalinks  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:26): You can get a StringBuffer from $request.getRequestURL() then delete everything in it, but what I have done was to use #define($output) then $output.toString()  
sdumitriu - (00:27): What's #define ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:29): Looking for it...  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:33): http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/vtl-reference-guide.html  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:33): It's here.  
vmassol left at 00:36 (Quit: Leaving.

Denis joined #xwiki at 08:57

evalica joined #xwiki at 10:03  
vmassol - (10:04): lucaa: good morning  
vmassol - (10:05): you should add @since tags to your annotation classes  
lucaa - (10:05): vmassol: good morning, I was just writing to you  
lucaa - (10:05): could you have a look at the commits and tell me if there something more to do to get the integration right?  
lucaa - (10:05): ok, will do (if I don't get bored at one point)  
vmassol - (10:06): it's a big commit so it'll take me several days/weeks to absorb the commit :)  
xenon75 joined #xwiki at 10:06  
vmassol - (10:06): I'll try to run the feature later this morning though  
lucaa - (10:07): it's not that big, I mean the infrastructure part. There are quite some sources but otherwise not very many modified poms...  
vmassol - (10:07): one small comment I have is that you have added lots of annotation deps to the web/standard pom  
lucaa - (10:07): yes, I know  
vmassol - (10:07): yes I'm talking generally about the code, not the integration  
vmassol - (10:07): another strategy would be to have a special module in annotations/  
lucaa - (10:08): that pulls all the annotation module, right?  
vmassol - (10:08): that either generates a single jar and thus have all the deps specified  
lucaa - (10:08): is that an acceptable strategy?  
vmassol - (10:08): or is just a pom aggregator (but I think this is only in maven 3.0)  
lucaa - (10:08): ok  
vmassol - (10:10): it's not a big deal  
vmassol - (10:10): and it can wait a bit till we agree on a general strategy, we have the same need for rendering I think  
lucaa - (10:10): ok  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:13  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:13  
jvdrean left at 10:17 (Client Quit  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:18  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 10:23  
jvdrean left at 10:29 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:29  
mflorea left at 10:34 (Quit: Leaving.  
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:39  
lucaa - (10:48): vmassol: we add since tags to all classes or only to non-internal?  
vmassol - (10:49): minimum is to all user-public classes indeed  
vmassol - (10:49): personally I use it for all but you can do the minimum  
lucaa - (10:49): ok, I'll add to all then  
lucaa - (10:49): there seem to be a few non-expanded ids too which I'd better spot  
sdumitriu - (10:51): I have a script for this  
sdumitriu - (10:51): find -name \*.java -execdir ~/pssvnid.sh {} \;  
sdumitriu - (10:51): Where pssvnid.sh contains:  
sdumitriu - (10:51): if [[ -z `svn pg svn:keywords $1` ]]  
sdumitriu - (10:51): then  
sdumitriu - (10:51):  svn ps svn:keywords Id $1  
sdumitriu - (10:51): fi  
sdumitriu - (10:51): if [[ -z `svn pg svn:eol-style $1` ]]  
sdumitriu - (10:51): then  
sdumitriu - (10:51):  svn ps svn:eol-style native $1  
lucaa - (10:52): sdumitriu: of course :)  
sdumitriu - (10:52): fi  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:54  
jvelociter - (10:55): hi guys  
vmassol - (10:56): hi jvelociter  
lucaa - (10:56): hi jvelociter  
jvelociter - (10:56): Q about the configuration module / xwiki.properties. Do we have the possibility of adding extra properties from a project pom.xml (for example a project with a web/ module that depends on web/standard)  
vmassol - (10:57): not sure what you mean  
vmassol - (10:57): especially since there should be no config value by default  
vmassol - (10:58): (at least so far we've succeeded in doing that)  
jvelociter - (10:58): yes but what if I want to override default values in a project for example ?  
vmassol - (10:58): so this is in a custom project not in platform right?  
jvelociter - (10:58): i.e. when generating the web/ module of my project I want a xwiki.properties with different defaults  
jvelociter - (10:58): yes  
vmassol - (10:59): you can replace the file altogether of course  
jvelociter - (10:59): yes but that's not very stable in the long run  
vmassol - (10:59): right  
jvelociter - (11:00): I could have a new configuration source  
jvelociter - (11:00): myproject.properties  
vmassol - (11:00): actually  
jvelociter - (11:00): that has a higher priority than xwiki.properties  
jvelociter - (11:00): and override here  
vmassol - (11:01): I was thinking about something slightly different over the weekend  
vmassol - (11:01): we haven't used the commons configuration notion of composite sources yet  
tmortagne - (11:01): jvelociter: should not be too hard to add value to any file with maven  
jvelociter - (11:01): tmortagne: you append content  
jvelociter - (11:01): yes I could look into that too  
vmassol - (11:02): http://commons.apache.org/configuration/userguide/howto\_configurationbuilder.html#Using\_DefaultConfigurationBuilder  
vmassol - (11:02): commons config has the ability to specify a file that describes the config files location  
vmassol - (11:02): (and allow chaining too btw)  
jvelociter - (11:03): cool  
vmassol - (11:03): I'm still unsure if we want to use that and how we'd use it though  
lucaa - (11:04): sdumitriu: it seems we have different shells, I have quite some errors...  
gmpff - (11:04): hi  
vmassol - (11:04): jvelociter: btw you can use an Ant task to perform replaces too, there are good replace tasks in Ant  
jvelociter - (11:04): I will look into the maven shade plugin for now to generate the proper xwiki.properties, but I keep that in mind  
vmassol - (11:04): shade?  
vmassol - (11:04): shade is to generate an uberjar  
jvelociter - (11:06): it looks like you can do file merging with it  
sdumitriu - (11:06): lucaa: Don't forget to close the fi at the end  
sdumitriu - (11:06): I forgot to paste it  
lucaa - (11:06): sdumitriu: I didn't  
vmassol - (11:06): jvelociter: maybe but it's not its goal  
jvelociter - (11:06): ah ok I misread. that's not what I'm looking for  
jvelociter - (11:06): yes  
gmpff - (11:06): I'm writing an integration layer on XWiki Enterprise so that we can interact with XWiki from other backend systems (system-to-system interaction). However, I want to expose my own interface and write the logic layer in Python (so using the XWiki REST API directly from the other backend system won't work). So far, my options seem to be to either write a new Struts action that invokes Python scripts on disk or to write the integration layer entirely separately  
gmpff - (11:06): in Python and access XWiki using the REST API. REST API solution is more decoupled, which is good, but I might run into limitations on this API. Or was the REST API created exactly with this use case in mind ? Suggestions ?  
jvelociter - (11:06): ok, I'll search for something else maven or ant  
tmortagne - (11:07): jvelociter: should be possible with assembly plugin too i think  
lucaa - (11:07): sdumitriu: I get this kind of things:  
lucaa - (11:07): /home/lucaa/pssvnid.sh: 4: [[: not found  
vmassol - (11:08): gmpff: does it mean you'd be interested in generating new REST APIs from within a wiki page?  
vmassol - (11:08): (not sure I understand fully what you want to do)  
gmpff - (11:09): vmassol: I want to write the code outside of wiki pages.  
vmassol - (11:09): lucaa: have you specified the shell as the first line of your script?  
lucaa - (11:09): no I havent  
bblfish left at 11:09 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
gmpff - (11:09): vmassol: but the code needs to interact with the wiki content.  
vmassol - (11:09): gmpff: I don't understand  
lucaa - (11:09): but if at sdumitriu works without then it means we have different shells...  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 11:09  
vmassol - (11:09): well that's using the XWiki REST API from the client side  
vmassol - (11:10): what's the pb with that?  
gmpff - (11:10): vmassol: I want to define my own API to the client apps. Isolate from a specific CMS.  
vmassol - (11:10): yes but what's the realtionship with xwiki?  
gmpff - (11:10): vmassol: it's the source of the data.  
vmassol - (11:10): yes but you can get the data using REST for that  
gmpff - (11:10): vmassol: e.g. I want to render an index of all pages in a space as an XML document with a schema that I define.  
vmassol - (11:10): still not understanding the pb :)  
gmpff - (11:11): vmassol: my own schema.  
vmassol - (11:11): ok so you get the data from xwiki using REST API and then you expose it in your client  
vmassol - (11:11): ?  
gmpff - (11:11): That would work, yes.  
gmpff - (11:12): However, what if I tomorrow want to create a space from that same client script ? Seems that the REST API can't do that.  
sdumitriu - (11:12): Spaces don't exist  
sdumitriu - (11:12): You can't create a space  
vmassol - (11:12): gmpff: you can  
gmpff - (11:12): So my question is: is the REST API general purpose enough or is it mainly for extracting content  ?  
vmassol - (11:12): you create a MySpace.WebHome document  
sdumitriu - (11:12): Just create a document with that space  
vmassol - (11:12): gmpff: it's both for readind AND writing  
gmpff - (11:13): So there should be no real benefit (apart from maybe reduced latency) in going for the Struts action option ?  
vmassol - (11:13): (spaces are indeed implicit, see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Spaces )  
vmassol - (11:13): gmpff: right, no real benefit (not even sure what it would mean)  
gmpff - (11:14): Thanks. Sorry for not knowing this yet. Many of the xwiki subtleties still elude me.  
vmassol - (11:14): no pb!  
gmpff - (11:14): vmassol: what what would mean ?  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 11:14  
vmassol - (11:14): not sure why you'd want to write a struts action  
vmassol - (11:14): if you wanted to extend the XWIki REST API you'd write a component  
vmassol - (11:15): (a REST resource component)  
gmpff - (11:15): So that I can execute Python code on disk that interacts with the xwiki Java API.  
gmpff - (11:15): hmmmm ..... that makes more sense.  
gmpff - (11:15): So instead of creating another integration point (i.e. Python scripts on disk), I just extend the existing REST API one.  
vmassol - (11:15): in some future you'll be able to extend the XWIKi REST API directly from within xwiki pages  
vmassol - (11:15): in any scripting language of your choice :)  
sdumitriu - (11:15): gmpff: You could write a Jython script inside the wiki, it would be more simple  
vmassol - (11:16): sdumitriu: not sure you can do that right now...  
sdumitriu - (11:16): vmassol and tmortagne, there's a problem with section editing  
gmpff - (11:16): sdumitriu: been there done that, but it's difficult to debug and reuse code.  
tmortagne - (11:17): sdumitriu: what is the issue ?  
gmpff - (11:17): vmassol: does  the code inside  {{python}} not execute in Jython ? What am I  missing ?  
vmassol - (11:17): sdumitriu: actually I'm sure you cannot right now since the main REST componetn don't do dynamic lookups  
sdumitriu - (11:17): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/ft  
vmassol - (11:17): gmpff: I'm talking about extending the XWiki REST API from within wiki pages  
gmpff - (11:17): vmassol: ok, sorry.  
sdumitriu - (11:17): There are two {{html}}<h2> and one wiki ==  
sdumitriu - (11:18): There should not be section editing for the first two  
sdumitriu - (11:18): Normally headers generated inside macros have a class="wikigeneratedheader" or something like that  
sdumitriu - (11:18): But not inside {{html}}  
vmassol - (11:18): right....  
vmassol - (11:19): so we'd need the opposite strategy? :)  
vmassol - (11:19): (ie have a class for "normal" headers)  
sdumitriu - (11:19): That would solve it, but I don't like it  
sdumitriu - (11:19): That's an unneeded class  
sdumitriu - (11:19): We should not mark "normal" stuff  
vmassol - (11:20): yes, agreed  
tmortagne - (11:20): maybe it means we need to put back macro marker even in view  
sdumitriu - (11:22): The solution I'd like is to do a regexp at the end of the html macro processing, to introduce the wikigenerated class  
sdumitriu - (11:22): WDYT?  
tmortagne - (11:22): no need for a regexp  
sdumitriu - (11:22): Why?  
tmortagne - (11:22): we can do the same thing in the html macro xhtml renderer  
sdumitriu - (11:23): Even with clean=false?  
tmortagne - (11:23): ha no  
tmortagne - (11:23): did not seen it was real html header  
tmortagne - (11:23): regexp is pretty dangerous  
vmassol - (11:23): I don't like regexes either  
sdumitriu - (11:23): Yes, it's HTML header, not wiki header inside {{html}}  
sdumitriu - (11:24): Well, the alternative is SAX or DOM  
tmortagne - (11:24): and modifying html provided by the user is not right anyway  
vmassol - (11:24): view marker is a solution  
tmortagne - (11:24): we do whatever we want with html we generate but that's not the same thing with html content  
vmassol - (11:24): so that the section js stuff ignores what's inside that makrer  
sdumitriu - (11:25): The goal was to elliminate the JS  
vmassol - (11:25): sdumitriu: I don't remember what was the solution regarding this js btw  
sdumitriu - (11:25): I have it working with regexps  
sdumitriu - (11:25): Extra processing in contentview, after extracting the title  
lucaa - (11:31): vmassol: done with the since tags. Any other observations? Could I consider the integration well done now and close the associated issues?  
vmassol - (11:31): lucaa: no idea, you can always close if you think it's done  
vmassol - (11:31): I'm now rebuilding to test it  
tmortagne - (11:32): another idea is to use a special xhtml renderer to render the final XDOM, one that put the proper css where it's needed  
sdumitriu - (11:32): Nice logo from Sorana Secu, too bad it screams Confluence from a mile  
sdumitriu - (11:33): tmortagne: Why "special"?  
tmortagne - (11:33): it makes the whole thing better for perf, no need to reparse the html content after the document is rendered  
tmortagne - (11:33): sdumitriu: because it doe snot make sense to put section edition css at generic rendering module level  
sdumitriu - (11:33): Well, actually the perfect solution would be to not need the {{html}} macro  
vmassol - (11:34): sdumitriu: I don't see the new logo  
sdumitriu - (11:34): It's not in the page, it's in attachments  
vmassol - (11:35): ok it's there now thanks to Raluca  
tmortagne - (11:39): I'm convinced that the better is to render the document using a "viewxhtml/1.0" in the templates, we can generate the proper thing directly with all needed informations and don't need to have any crappy marker to reparse  
tmortagne - (11:39): sdumitriu: is ther an issue for section edition issue ?  
tmortagne - (11:39): jira issue  
sdumitriu - (11:39): No  
tmortagne - (11:40): creating one then  
anamarias - (11:40): hi. On user log-on or log-in I want to call a JS function, is there a way to create an event listener on the logout/login?  
sdumitriu - (11:40): tmortagne: Initially I wanted to insert section links using a transformation  
sdumitriu - (11:40): anamarias: Not with Javascript  
tmortagne - (11:40): sdumitriu: it's not transformation, it's a lot better at renderer level IMO  
anamarias - (11:42): sdumitriu: then how can I change the content of a page on user log-out ? I want to hide some divs (that contain some elements that allow the user to perform some actions)  
florinciu left at 11:43 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sdumitriu - (11:43): anamarias: User logout is usually done in a distinct HTTP request  
sdumitriu - (11:44): So you shouldn't have the same HTML  
sdumitriu - (11:44): Unless you have some AJAX call for this  
tmortagne - (11:44): XWIKI-5034  
vmassol - (11:45): s/is/in  
tmortagne - (11:45): yep it's fixed  
vmassol - (11:45): hmm the build fails for me in the app manager  
vmassol - (11:45): Running com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.applicationmanager.core.doc.objects.classes.XClassManagerTest  
vmassol - (11:45): Tests run: 26, Failures: 26, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 7.182 sec <<< FAILURE!  
vmassol - (11:45): (on trunk)  
vmassol - (11:46): checking logs  
tmortagne - (11:46): probably a mock issue with new apis or something like that  
anamarias - (11:46): sdumitriu: I see what you mean, the page is refreshed  
anamarias - (11:47): however, my code in a JSX object looks like this:  
vmassol - (11:47): indeed tmortagne  
anamarias - (11:47): document.observe('dom:loaded', function(event) {  
anamarias - (11:47): #if($context.hasAdminRights() || $context.hasAccessLevel('edit', $doc))  
anamarias - (11:47):    // code for when user is logged in  
anamarias - (11:47): #else  
anamarias - (11:47):   // code for when the user is LOGGED OUT  
anamarias - (11:47): #end  
tmortagne - (11:47): vmassol: i'm taking care of it  
vmassol - (11:47): ok  
anamarias - (11:47): and on a refresh, I guess it's kept in the cache  
anamarias - (11:47): the old one  
anamarias - (11:48): where should I put it to make sure it's not affected by cache?  
tmortagne - (11:48): vmassol: hmm what's weird is that application manager is supposed to be based on an older core  
sdumitriu - (11:48): anamarias: Don't put such velocity inside Javascript  
sdumitriu - (11:48): The script is cached  
sdumitriu - (11:48): There are two solutions:  
tmortagne - (11:48): so it should not have new pi mock issue  
sdumitriu - (11:48): 1. Don't cache the js  
sdumitriu - (11:48): 2. Get the data from the HTML  
anamarias - (11:48): how can I do 2 ?  
sdumitriu - (11:49): $context.hasAdminRights() can be detected by searching for the Administer Space element in the HTML  
anamarias - (11:49): I mean I need the info of whether the user is logged in or not  
anamarias - (11:49): hmm  
sdumitriu - (11:49): Logged in = Search for the HTML element holding the username  
tmortagne - (11:50): vmassol: my fault i modified the core version last time i have no idea why, fixing it  
sdumitriu - (11:50): The trick is to do what you as a human would do to detect this information  
sdumitriu - (11:50): i.e. look for certain elements in the page  
vmassol - (11:51): jvelociter: I don't remember why we're calling #template("deprecatedVars.vm") at the end of xwikivars.vm. Why is it not extravars.vm or xwikivarsoverride.vm or something like that?  
vmassol - (11:51): there's no comment before the template call  
vmassol - (11:51): reading it now, I don't understand the name "deprecated"  
jvelociter - (11:51): vmassol: I think you are confusing 2 templates  
vmassol - (11:51): ah yes  
vmassol - (11:52): you wanted to add a new one but you haven't done it, is that it?  
jvelociter - (11:52): deprecatedVars.vm has been introduce by Sergiu and I think it does what its name says : it keeps reference on deprecated vars  
jvelociter - (11:52): vmassol: I did it actually  
jvelociter - (11:52): let me find the name  
vmassol - (11:52): it's not in xwikivars.vm  
vmassol - (11:52): there are only 2 #template calls in there  
anamarias - (11:52): sdumitriu: do you mean look for the elements of the menu itself, like : <span class="submenuitem "><a href="/xwiki/bin/admin/Tests/WebPreferences" id="tmAdminSpace" class="tmAdminSpace">Administer Space</a></span> ?  
jvelociter - (11:53): vmassol layoutExtraVars.vm  
anamarias - (11:53): and no metadata or smth  
jvelociter - (11:53): it's called from layoutVars.vm  
vmassol - (11:53): hmm but that's only for layout  
vmassol - (11:53): not general vars  
jvelociter - (11:53): yes  
vmassol - (11:54): why do we need that?  
jvelociter - (11:54): we could have the same for xwikivars  
vmassol - (11:54): and why not have a single extra xwiki vars?  
vmassol - (11:54): (I don't think we need to multiplicate etxension points)  
jvelociter - (11:54): separation of concerns:)  
jvelociter - (11:54): but I agree it's arguable  
vmassol - (11:55): the pb is api follows different rules  
vmassol - (11:55): the less you have the more you're happy  
vmassol - (11:55): :)  
vmassol - (11:56): anyway just noticed jvdrean has reused deprecatedVars.vm for the wrong reaon  
vmassol - (11:56): reason  
vmassol - (11:56): so we need to fix this  
vmassol - (11:56): jvdrean: feel like fixing it?  
sdumitriu - (11:58): anamarias: Yes, something like:  
sdumitriu - (11:58): if ($('tmAdminSpace')) { has admin } else { looser }  
anamarias - (12:02): how about checking for edit rights? (not admin) is it smth similar?  
sdumitriu - (12:05): anamarias: if($('tmEdit'))  
anamarias - (12:05): ok, thanks  
sdumitriu - (12:05): vmassol: Don't you want to propose a logo?  
sdumitriu - (12:05): :)  
vmassol - (12:06): sdumitriu: nope
